questions.question: What is the SI unit of time?
What is the term for the time taken by a pendulum to complete one full oscillation?
Which instrument in a vehicle measures the distance travelled?
How is the speed of an object calculated?
questions.expected_answer: Total distance covered divided by the total time taken

questions.question: What factor determines the time period of a simple pendulum?
questions.expected_answer: The length of the pendulum (it does not depend on the bob's mass)

questions.question: When is an object said to be in uniform linear motion?
questions.expected_answer: When it moves along a straight line with a constant speed

questions.question: Name two ancient devices used for measuring time before mechanical clocks.
questions.expected_answer: Sundials, water clocks, hourglasses (sand clocks), or candle clocks

questions.question: Who invented the pendulum clock in 1656?
Define 'speed'.
questions.expected_answer: The distance covered by an object in a unit time.

questions.question: What is meant by 'oscillatory motion'?
questions.expected_answer: The to and fro motion of an object, such as a simple pendulum.

questions.question: What is non-uniform motion?
questions.expected_answer: Motion in which the speed of an object moving along a straight line keeps changing.

questions.question: What is a speedometer?
questions.expected_answer: An instrument on the dashboard of a vehicle that records the speed directly in km/h.
